Buying a first home as an investment can have long term benefits and help put young Australians in a better financial position for the following reasons: You can continue living at home and get into the property market sooner. The rental income can be used to help with the loan repayments and any savings can be put in an offset account to reduce interest on the loan. There are a wider range of properties to choose from.

Limiting yourself to just your home state could limit your potential to increase your capital gains and rental yield if you are not investing in areas with potential growth or demand. It is also a way of diversifying your risk by investing in different locations. There are a number of simple things you can do to limit the risks of buying interstate and improve your chances of buying in a strong market with a lot of potential.

item.title: Jack Wei
item.description: Our highly experienced team has over 19 years of combined experience in finance industry. During this time, we’ve helped many people significantly improve their financial independence and security. Get to know more about our team and how we can help you.

item.title: Kathy Robinson
item.description: As an experienced Mortgage Broker I really enjoy helping people achieve their dreams by securing finance for whatever their needs may be. I lead from the front. I will work with you every step of the way to ensure a smooth and trouble free application process. Calling me will be the best move to make.

item.title: Sam Chuang
item.description: About Sam is an experienced home loan lender with over 10 years working at both local and international banks. Sam is a self taught front end-web developer and UI/UX designer. He responsibled for the operation and the development of Loans101 platform. If you have any questions or feedback on how to make Loans101 a better place for customers and mortgage brokers, feel free to get in touch with Sam.
